solution_line_template: If the business's stock price rises {stock_rise_percent_text}%, then his share on the company is worth {stock_rise_percent_text}% multiplied by ${initial_investment} plus ${initial_investment} that he already had. That results in {stock_rise_percent_text}% * ${initial_investment} + ${initial_investment} = ${stock_increase_amount} + ${initial_investment} = $<<{stock_rise_percent_text}*{percent_factor}*{initial_investment}+{initial_investment}={new_stock_value}>>{new_stock_value}.
Since he already had ${wallet_money}, with ${new_stock_value} more he will have ${wallet_money} + ${new_stock_value} = $<<{wallet_money}+{new_stock_value}={total_money}>>{total_money}.
